which had nothing to do with war or politics but related to high society, to certain women, and to the official side of the 
1 Ours. 
service. These gentlemen received Prince An- drew as one of themselves, an honor they did not extend to many. From politeness and to start conversation, they asked him a few ques- tions about the army and the battle, and then the talk went off into merry jests and gossip. 
"But the best of it was," said one, telling of the misfortune of a fellow diplomat
